chapter.title: Initial Setup
chapter.para: After you started a new &PRODUCT; system the first time, the Initial Setup application launches, if you installed the server:

listitem.para: Using the Server with GUI base environment in the &PRODUCT; setup.
Using a Kickstart file that contains one of the following entries in the %packages section:
the initial-setup-gui package for graphical mode
the initial-setup package for text mode

chapter.para: The Initial Setup application can display the following options:

row.entry:
License agreement
This option is only displayed if you did not previously agreed to the license.

Language settings
This option is only displayed if you did not previously set it.

Yes
This option is only available if you run Initial Setup in reconfiguration mode

important.para: Options set during the setup are not displayed in the Initial Setup. To display all options in Initial Setup, you must install &PRODUCT; using a Kickstart file that contains the following command:
The --reconfig option specifies that all options should be displayed. For further details about Kickstart installations, see .

section.title: Graphical Mode
section.para: In graphical mode, the Initial Setup displays the following screen:
The License Agreement screen displays the overall licensing terms for &PRODUCT;.

textobject.para: License Information Screen in Initial Setup

section.para: In order to continue with the configuration process, the license agreement must be accepted. Exiting Initial Setup without completing this step will cause the system to restart, and once the system finishes rebooting, you will be prompted to accept the agreement again.
Review the license agreement. Then, select I accept the license agreement. and click Done to continue.
The User Creation screen is the same as the one used when creating an account during the installation. See for detailed information.
Similarly, the Network & Host Name screen is the same as the one used when setting up network. See for information.

The Subscription Manager screen allows you to register your system with Red Hat to receive updates and install additional packages from repositories provided by Red Hat. For information about how to register your system, see .
Once ready, click the FINISH CONFIGURATION button to register your system, before completing the Initial Setup configuration process.
To start the Initial Setup again, see .
